bullets.text: U.N. Security Council endorses Trump’s Gaza peace plan, increasing diplomatic pressure for cease-fire, phased Israeli withdrawal and reconstruction framework.
Fed Governor Waller backs December rate cut, citing weakening labor market and easing inflation, reinforcing market expectations of near-term easing.
S&P 500 and Nasdaq log worst day in a month as tech momentum falters; strategists warn of further selling amid AI bubble fears.
Alphabet shares jump after Berkshire reveals stake; investors eye next catalysts in AI, YouTube profitability and cloud margins.
Arm-Nvidia partnership links custom Arm CPUs with NVLink, bolstering heterogeneous AI systems and Arm’s data center ambitions.
Sinclair takes stake in E.W. Scripps, pushes merger as deregulation advances; Scripps stock surges 40%, signaling renewed local-TV consolidation.
Novo Nordisk cuts direct cash prices for Wegovy and Ozempic to $349/month, potentially accelerating GLP-1 adoption and pressuring competitors.
Medicare Part B premium set to rise 9.7% in 2026, squeezing seniors and adding to healthcare cost pressures.
Bitcoin erases 2025 gains amid sharp selloff; analysts warn of crypto winter dynamics as liquidity thins and leveraged longs unwind.
Microfluidic liquid cooling advances could curb AI data center energy use, improving chip performance and sustainability.
Princeton unveils quantum chip architecture advancing toward practical quantum advantage, improving error rates and scalability.
CRISPR-based strategy overcomes resistance in certain lung cancers, highlighting a potential therapeutic pathway against refractory tumors.
